alert.note: Alert for Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 5:02PM PDT until August 24 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Monument burn scar in... West Central Trinity County in northwestern California... * Until 630 PM PDT. * At 502 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Monument Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the area from Del Loma to Burnt Ranch including Highway 299. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Monument Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Monument Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Del Loma. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Monument Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
